Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav and Virat Kohli both scored fifties and made sure India reach a stiff total of 192/2 against Hong Kong.
In reply, Hong Kong started well as the young Indian pacers faltered. But once the Indian spinners came into picture, Hong Kong chase lost steam.
Although Nizakat Khan and Babar Hayatt tried their best, but they eventually fell short.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma was dismissed early, followed by KL Rahul.
Suryakumar Yadav took over and launched the Hong Kong spinners across all corners, racing to his fifty in no time.
Virat Kohli got to his first international fifty since February.
Suryakumar Yadav remained unbeaten at 68 off 26 balls, while Kohli was unbeaten at 59 off 44.
Post-Match Reflections: Hong Kong fall short by 40 runs and India has qualified for the Super Fours.
The difference in the end was SKY’s fifty—it made all the difference.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India had to bat first and lost the wicket of Rohit Sharma early.
KL Rahul was also dismissed after a slow 36 off 39 balls.
Nizakat Khan won the toss and played his first ball on the front foot, opting to bowl first.
India will have to bat first after Hong Kong win toss and opted to bowl in their opening game in this year’s Asia Cup.
